column4: after a fresh install, what's the root password?  i've tried nothing, root and ubuntu and no luck
any takers on the root password??
your user password and its sudo not su
yes but use sudo not su
if you look closley nothing in ubuntu standard install asks for root password
you might beable to do binutil --version
i also saw ld -v but the apt-cache seems like the more consistent way across all installed pkgs; and i did try binutil -v but it's a collection of utilities so apt-cache is the way to go
apt-get install wants the breezy cd; anyway i can force it to load it from the web?
put a # infront of the cdrom repos in your /etc/apt/sources.list and take the # away fromt he rest
ty that worked; quick cvs question; if i access a cvs repos. via anonymous login, should i have to enter a cvs password? it is prompting for one; this is the www.denx.de linux cvs repos.
